item.title: Prof Chris Whitty: Man pleads guilty to park assault
item.description: Lewis Hughes pleads guilty to assaulting England's chief medical officer Chris Whitty in central London.

item.title: Esther Dingley: Remains confirmed as those of missing hiker
item.description: Esther Dingley disappeared in the Pyrenees mountains in November.

item.title: Harvey Price: Met officers probed over 'inappropriate' WhatsApp messages
item.description: Katie Price calls for eight police officers to be sacked amid allegations they made comments about her son.

item.title: Storm Evert: Strong winds and heavy rain cause disruption
item.description: There were more than 20 rescues off the Isles of Scilly where winds reached 69mph (111km/h).

item.title: Kirklees child sex abuse: 40 arrests in Dewsbury and Batley investigation
item.description: The arrests relate to the alleged abuse of nine girls in the Dewsbury and Batley area, say police.

item.title: 'Brighton cat killer' Steven Bouquet jailed for stabbing 16 pets
item.description: Steven Bouquet has been jailed for more than five years after he killed nine cats in night attacks.

item.title: Latitude festival-goers test positive for coronavirus
item.description: The 40,000 people a day Latitude festival is a Covid-19 restrictions test event for the government.

item.title: Lee McKnight: Six jailed for murdering man found dumped in river
item.description: Four men and a mother and daughter are detained over the fatal beating of Lee McKnight.

item.title: Jordan Lee: Blackpool man who murdered baby daughter jailed
item.description: Jordan Lee was heard shouting at the four-month-old to "shut-up" before severely beating her.

item.title: Callum Baker-Osborne: Body found in coast search for teen swimmer
item.description: Callum Baker-Osborne went missing from a group that got into difficulty off the Dorset coast.

item.title: Hackney Council IT data blunder 'could have cost lives'
item.description: Hackney Council accidentally made the names and addresses of vulnerable women publicly available.

item.title: Drug dealer's wife who led lavish lifestyle jailed
item.description: Ellie Tobin spent thousands of pounds on luxury holidays, Rolex watches and designer clothes.

item.title: Covid: Which children are being vaccinated and why?
item.description: Hundreds of thousands of children at higher risk from coronavirus infection will be offered a Covid vaccine in the UK.

item.title: Why you shouldn't get a second Covid jab too early
item.description: A government scientific advisor tells Newsbeat why four weeks is too soon between Covid jabs.

item.title: Beta coronavirus variant: What is the risk?
item.description: There are fears that this version of coronavirus, first identified in South Africa, is

item.title: Covid rules: How can the clinically vulnerable stay safe?
item.description: As social-distancing and other Covid rules end in England, how can people who were shielding stay safe?

item.title: What are the rules and guidance for face masks and coverings from 19 July?
item.description: Masks are no longer compulsory in England, but remain necessary in Scotland and Wales.

item.title: Devon teacher brings history lessons to TikTok
item.description: Laurie Matthews has taken her road trip history lessons to TikTok whilst camping in her Fiat 500.

item.title: ‘My dog travelled 50 miles on a bus to Kent’
item.description: Chip the Norfolk terrier jumped on board a double-decker wedding bus by mistake.

item.title: Parkinson's disease: Painter finds freedom in painting
item.description: Jan Sargeant paints to express herself after being diagnosed with Parkinson's disease.

item.title: Manchester teenager urges black people to give blood
item.description: Zenith, 18, began donating blood to support her brother Charming, who has sickle cell disease.

item.title: Covid: The doctor sisters working through the pandemic
item.description: Caitlín and Megan Prosser have been supporting each other throughout the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: Stephen Bear: Reality TV star denies sexual images charges
item.description: Stephen Bear, who won Celebrity Big Brother, denies sharing private images and voyeurism.

item.title: Wirral baby death: DNA database used to find family
item.description: Police are continuing efforts to find the family of baby boy whose body was found on a golf course.

item.title: Parton landslide: Community rallies as worries grow
item.description: Villagers are pulling together after cracks in a hill forced 14 families to leave their homes.

item.title: M1: Woman caught driving at 130mph 'needed the toilet'
item.description: Officers pointed out the woman had actually sped past motorway services.

item.title: Hastings sewage leak: Bulverhythe beach closed after pipe breaks
item.description: Sewage spilt from a burst pipe for a second time after Southern Water turned on a pumping station.

item.title: Manchester shipping container homeless village to be built
item.description: The village includes 40 permanent homes for rough sleepers and will be built by the River Irwell.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Bethany Shriever wins BMX gold as GB claim six medals
item.description: Bethany Shriever claimed a thrilling BMX gold and Duncan Scott extended his streak in the pool as Great Britain won six Olympic medals on Friday.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Dina Asher-Smith into 100m semis as Ta Lou, Fraser-Pryce & Thompson-Herah set pace
item.description: Dina Asher-Smith starts her bid to become the first British woman to win an Olympic individual sprint gold with progress in the 100m heats.

item.title: Luke Campbell: London 2012 gold medallist retires
item.description: Britain's Luke Campbell, who won Olympic gold at London 2012, retires from boxing.
